text: Why is it important to not use plastic water bottles at the site?
suggesion: Plastic bottles are not considered biodegradable waste, which means that they can clog landfills, are littered and are a source of pollution, especially in our waterbodies. Also, plastic bags can take upto 20 years to decompose, whereas plastic bottles can take up to 450 years! So it’s important to not use plastic water bottles. We can use eco-friendly and compostable alternatives such as glass, steel, or plant-based bottles.!

text: Where can you find pure Grand Canyon spring water?
suggesion: Springwater can be found at the springs below the North Rim throughout Grand Canyon’s park.

text: How many water bottles are used by Americans every year?
suggesion: On an average, Americans use around 167 bottles a year.

text: How much does one bottle cost?
suggesion: One bottle costs around $2 (that’s $334 a year)

text: How much does it cost to fill bottles at the Grand Canyon?
suggesion: It doesn’t cost anything because the water filling stations are free of charge and provide pure Grand Canyon water.
